planet.name: Uranus

generalInfo.description: Uranus is the seventh planet from the Sun and the third-largest in the solar system. It is an ice giant primarily composed of hydrogen, helium, and water, ammonia, and methane ice.
generalInfo.namesake: Uranus is named after the ancient Greek god of the sky.
generalInfo.age: Uranus was discovered in 1781 by astronomer William Herschel.

potentialForLife.description: Uranus' extreme cold, high atmospheric pressure, and lack of a solid surface make it highly unlikely to support life.
potentialForLife.climateChangeImpact: Uranus' atmosphere and conditions remain unaffected by human activities due to its distance and natural atmospheric dynamics.

sizeAndDistance.rank: Third largest planet in the solar system

orbitAndRotation.leapYearExplanation: Uranus does not experience leap years due to its long orbital period.
orbitAndRotation.seasonalEffects: Uranus' extreme axial tilt causes it to experience dramatic seasonal variations over its 84-year orbit.

moons.description: Uranus has 27 known moons, named after characters from Shakespearean plays and Alexander Pope's poetry.
moons.origin: The moons are believed to have formed from the same disk of gas and dust as the planet.
moons.averageDistance: Varies significantly, with Miranda orbiting closest at about 80,000 miles.
moons.rankInSize: Titania is the largest moon of Uranus and the eighth-largest in the solar system.

planet.rings: Uranus has a thin and dark ring system composed of ice and rock particles.

formation.description: Uranus formed about 4.5 billion years ago from the primordial gas and dust cloud that shaped the solar system.

layers.name: Core
layers.description: A dense, rocky core with temperatures up to 9,000°F (5,000°C).

layers.name: Mantle
layers.description: A thick layer of water, ammonia, and methane ice surrounding the core.

layers.name: Atmosphere
layers.description: An outer layer of hydrogen, helium, and methane gases, giving Uranus its blue-green color.

surface.features: Uranus has no solid surface, with its outer layers composed of swirling gases and a slushy ocean of water, ammonia, and methane.
surface.oceanCoverage: No oceans exist, but a 'slushy' mantle of water and ammonia ice lies beneath the atmosphere.
surface.volcanicActivity: No volcanic activity is present, though its moon Miranda shows signs of past tectonic and cryovolcanic activity.

composition.other: Trace amounts of ammonia and water vapor

atmosphere.protection: The atmosphere provides no protection due to extreme conditions, including high pressures and low temperatures.

magnetosphere.cause: Generated by electric currents in the icy mantle of Uranus.
magnetosphere.effects: Uranus' magnetic field is tilted and offset, causing unique auroras and interactions with solar wind.
magnetosphere.polarityReversal: The magnetic field may undergo polarity reversals, though these are not well understood.
